PART 1 ONCE UPON A TIME ... THE CONSOLIDATION 5
1 The slow evolution of consolidation requirements 6
1.1 The 1970s: The pencil and eraser age
1.2 The 1980s: The beginnings of the computer age 9
1.3 The 1990s: The search for a miracle solution 10
2 What can we expect in the future? 15
2.1 The structure of the data to consolidate and its processing in consolidation 15
2.2 The reconciliation of inter-company balances: is there hope? 16
2.4 Statutory consolidation and reporting: unified consolidation 19
2.7 Impact of future technological changes on consolidation 22
1 THE ECONOMICAL. FINANCIAL AND LEGAL CONTEXT OF THE CONSOLIDATION 26
2 CONSOLIDATION: A STEP BY STEP PROCESS 29
2.1 Step 1: Identify the companies to include in the consolidation scope 30
2.2 Step 2: Collect the information from each company correctly and in time 31
2.3 Step 3: Translate all the information received into the consolidation currency 32
2.4 Step 4: Identify all intercompany differences and ask for explanations 33
2.5 Step 5: Book all necessary consolidation adjustments depending on group situation and consolidation rules 33
2.6 Step 6: Process all necessary eliminations to get a consolidated set of information 35
2.7 Step 7: Report consolidated figures to all addressees.. 36
3.3 When different types of shares represent the capital of a company 42
3.4 Some groups with more complex structures 43
3.6 Algorithm to calculate indirect financial percentages in complex group structures 49
4.5 Comparison between the different consolidation methods.. 61
4.6 The value of a company from a consolidation point of view 62
5.3 Why applying a percentage on the investments when eliminating them?69
6.2 Currency translation of a balance sheet and a P&L 72
6.3 How do we consolidate foreign companies? 74
6.5 How to manage historical rates on the equity accounts? 78
7.1 Some important principles about intercompany matching 82
8.2 A company doesn't apply the group's rules in its statutory accounts 93
8.3 Disposal of an asset between two companies. with a group profit .. 96
8.5 Leasing not booked in balance sheet 104
8.7 Elimination of dividends in a classical situation 112
8.8 Elimination of dividends paid by a foreign company 117
8.10 Statutory write-off of a consolidated financial investment 125
8.12 Acquisition of a company with a badwill 128
8.13 Acquisition of a company with a goodwill 130
